tensorlayer.cost¶

cross_entropy(output, target) Return the cost function of cross-entropy between two distribution.
li_regularizer(scale) Returns a function that can be used to apply group li regularization to weights.
lo_regularizer(scale) Returns a function that can be used to apply group lo regularization to weights.
maxnorm_regularizer([scale]) Returns a function that can be used to apply max-norm regularization to weights.
maxnorm_o_regularizer(scale) Returns a function that can be used to apply max-norm regularization to each column of weight matrix.
maxnorm_i_regularizer(scale) Returns a function that can be used to apply max-norm regularization to each row of weight matrix.

Cost functions¶

tensorlayer.cost.cross_entropy(output, target)[source]¶

Return the cost function of cross-entropy between two distribution.

output
: tensorflow variable
A distribution with shape: [None, n_feature].
target
: tensorflow variable
A distribution with shape: [None, n_feature].
>>> xxx
>>> xxx

About cross-entropy: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross_entropy The code are borrowed from: https://github.com/cmgreen210/TensorFlowDeepAutoencoder/blob/master/code/ae/autoencoder.py

Regularization functions¶

tensorlayer.cost.li_regularizer(scale)[source]¶

Returns a function that can be used to apply group li regularization to weights. https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/regularizers.py li regularization removes the neurons of previous layer. ‘i’ represents ‘inputs’

scale: A scalar multiplier Tensor. 0.0 disables the regularizer.

A function with signature li(weights, name=None) that apply L1 regularization.

ValueError: If scale is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0] or if scale is not a float.

tensorlayer.cost.lo_regularizer(scale)[source]¶

Returns a function that can be used to apply group lo regularization to weights. see: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/regularizers.py Lo regularization removes the neurons of current layer. ‘o’ represents outputs

scale: A scalar multiplier Tensor. 0.0 disables the regularizer.

A function with signature lo(weights, name=None) that apply Lo regularization.

ValueError: If scale is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0] or if scale is not a float.

tensorlayer.cost.maxnorm_regularizer(scale=1.0)[source]¶

Returns a function that can be used to apply max-norm regularization to weights. see: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/regularizers.py https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_norm#Max_norm Max-norm regularization

scale: A scalar multiplier Tensor. 0.0 disables the regularizer.

A function with signature mn(weights, name=None) that apply Lo regularization.

ValueError: If scale is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0] or if scale is not a float.

tensorlayer.cost.maxnorm_o_regularizer(scale)[source]¶

Returns a function that can be used to apply max-norm regularization to each column of weight matrix. see: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/regularizers.py https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_norm#Max_norm Max-norm output regularization removes the neurons of current layer.

scale: A scalar multiplier Tensor. 0.0 disables the regularizer.

A function with signature mn_o(weights, name=None) that apply Lo regularization.

ValueError: If scale is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0] or if scale is not a float.

tensorlayer.cost.maxnorm_i_regularizer(scale)[source]¶

Returns a function that can be used to apply max-norm regularization to each row of weight matrix. see: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/regularizers.py https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_norm#Max_norm Max-norm output regularization removes the neurons of current layer.

scale: A scalar multiplier Tensor. 0.0 disables the regularizer.

A function with signature mn_i(weights, name=None) that apply Lo regularization.

ValueError: If scale is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0] or if scale is not a float.
